Battle of Edgehill",'
Battle of Edgehill
23 October, 1642
English Civil War
No clear winner
The first major battle in the 17th century struggle for power between King and Parliament known as the English Civil War was fought in the open fields surrounding the small Warwickshire village of Edgehill, on Sunday 23rd October 1642. It was intended to be the battle that decided the outcome of the war; in reality it turned out to be somewhat of a 'bloody' draw as each side fielded 15,000 inexperienced troops. Although he had taken control of the road to London, King Charles failed to seize the initiative and withdrew his army to Oxford, his capital for the rest of the war. The inconclusive result of the battle prevented either side gaining a quick victory and the war would drag on for four more years.
